      • setConnectorWidth

        public void setConnectorWidth(java.lang.Number connectorWidth)
        The width of the line connecting the data label to the point. In styled mode, the connector stroke width is given in the .highcharts-data-label-connector class.

        Try it:

         •  Custom connector width and color

      • getConnectorWidth

        public java.lang.Number getConnectorWidth()

      • setAlternate

        public void setAlternate(java.lang.Boolean alternate)
        Whether to position data labels alternately. For example, if distance is set equal to 100, then data labels will be positioned alternately (on both sides of the point) at a distance of 100px.

        Try it:

         •  Alternate disabled

      • getAlternate

        public java.lang.Boolean getAlternate()

      • setConnectorColor

        public void setConnectorColor(java.lang.String connectorColor)
        The color of the line connecting the data label to the point. The defaults color is the same as the point's color. In styled mode, the connector stroke is given in the .highcharts-data-label-connector class.

      • getConnectorColor

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(java.lang.Number distance)
        A pixel value defining the distance between the data label and the point. Negative numbers puts the label on top of the point.
